com.github.dm.jrt.android.core.invocation

Class ContextInvocationFactory<IN,OUT>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dm.jrt.android.core.invocation.ContextInvocationFactory<IN,OUT>
  • Type Parameters:
    IN - the input data type.
    OUT - the output data type.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DecoratingContextInvocationFactory

    public abstract class ContextInvocationFactory<IN,OUT>
extends Object
    Abstract class defining a factory of context invocations.
    The inheriting class must specify the constructor arguments to be used in the equals() and hashCode() implementations. Note that such methods might be employed to uniquely identify the loader backing the routine execution.

    Created by davide-maestroni on 05/01/2015.

      int hashCode() 
      abstract ContextInvocation<IN,OUT> newInvocation()
      Creates and return a new context invocation instance.
      A proper implementation will return a new invocation instance each time it is called, unless the returned object is immutable and does not cause any side effect.
      Any behavior other than that may lead to unexpected results.

        getClass, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> ContextInvocationFactory<IN,OUT> factoryFrom(@NotNull
                                                            InvocationFactory<IN,OUT> factory)
        Builds and returns a new context invocation factory wrapping the specified one.
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        factory - the invocation factory.
        Returns:
        the invocation factory.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the class of the specified factory has not a static scope.

      • factoryOf

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> ContextInvocationFactory<IN,OUT> factoryOf(@NotNull
                                                          Class<? extends ContextInvocation<IN,OUT>> invocationClass)
        Builds and returns a new context invocation factory creating instances of the specified class.

        Note that inner and anonymous classes can be passed as well. Remember however that Java creates synthetic constructors for such classes, so be sure to specify the correct arguments to guarantee proper instantiation.

        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        invocationClass - the invocation class.
        Returns:
        the invocation factory.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the class of the specified invocation has not a static scope or no default construct is found.

      • factoryOf

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> ContextInvocationFactory<IN,OUT> factoryOf(@NotNull
                                                          Class<? extends ContextInvocation<IN,OUT>> invocationClass,
                                                          @Nullable
                                                          Object... args)
        Builds and returns a new context invocation factory creating instances of the specified class by passing the specified arguments to the class constructor.

        Note that inner and anonymous classes can be passed as well. Remember however that Java creates synthetic constructors for such classes, so be sure to specify the correct arguments to guarantee proper instantiation.

        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        invocationClass - the invocation class.
        args - the invocation constructor arguments.
        Returns:
        the invocation factory.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the class of the specified invocation has not a static scope or no construct constructor taking the specified objects as parameters is found.

      • factoryOf

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> ContextInvocationFactory<IN,OUT> factoryOf(@NotNull
                                                          ClassToken<? extends ContextInvocation<IN,OUT>> invocationToken)
        Builds and returns a new context invocation factory creating instances of the specified class token.

        Note that class tokens of inner and anonymous classes can be passed as well. Remember however that Java creates synthetic constructors for such classes, so be sure to specify the correct arguments to guarantee proper instantiation.

        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        invocationToken - the invocation class token.
        Returns:
        the invocation factory.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the class of the specified invocation has not a static scope or no default construct is found.

      • factoryOf

        @NotNull
public static <IN,OUT> ContextInvocationFactory<IN,OUT> factoryOf(@NotNull
                                                          ClassToken<? extends ContextInvocation<IN,OUT>> invocationToken,
                                                          @Nullable
                                                          Object... args)
        Builds and returns a new context invocation factory creating instances of the specified class token by passing the specified arguments to the class constructor.

        Note that class tokens of inner and anonymous classes can be passed as well. Remember however that Java creates synthetic constructors for such classes, so be sure to specify the correct arguments to guarantee proper instantiation.

        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        invocationToken - the invocation class token.
        args - the invocation constructor arguments.
        Returns:
        the invocation factory.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the class of the specified invocation has not a static scope or no construct constructor taking the specified objects as parameters is found.

      • newInvocation

        @NotNull
public abstract ContextInvocation<IN,OUT> newInvocation()
                                                 throws Exception
        Creates and return a new context invocation instance.
        A proper implementation will return a new invocation instance each time it is called, unless the returned object is immutable and does not cause any side effect.
        Any behavior other than that may lead to unexpected results.
        Returns:
        the context invocation instance.
        Throws:
        Exception - if an unexpected error occurs.
